title: Google Glass: Too Creepy to Succeed
description: A quick, practical guide to Google Glass: Too Creepy to Succeed.

hook.text: Google Glass was revolutionary technology that nobody wanted to be seen wearing. Social design killed it.

buildup.text: Launched in 2013, Glass let you record video, get directions, and check messages â€” all hands-free.

discovery.text: People near Glass wearers felt surveilled. Bars banned 'Glassholes.' The technology worked; the social design failed.

twist.text: Glass pivoted to enterprise use â€” warehouses, surgery, manufacturing â€” where recording is expected, not creepy.

climax.text: Google Glass proved that product design must account for social context, not just individual utility.

punchline.text: The most advanced wearable failed because other people hated it.

quiz.question: Why did Google Glass fail as a consumer product?
